intro: Craspedia alba, commonly known as the white everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow blooms that are arranged in flat-topped clusters. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Craspedia alba is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
